page.title: 04R.A.F. Weston-on-the-Green
page.content: Since it was constructed in the 1914-18 war,it has operated in the training role. It never aquired permanent runways,and this fact has contributed to its survival as an airfield,for it has been used principally as parachute dropping zone by No.1 Parachute Train- ing School since 1946. This school has been based at Upper Heyford,then Abing- don and now Brize Norton.At the present time trainee paratroops make their first descents from a basket suspended beneath a captive baloon at Weston, followed by drops from Hercules air- craft of the Lyneham Transport Wing, culminating in drops in full combat gear with weapon packs suspended below their feet.Instructors,members of the Special Forces and NATO paratroops also use the airfield for exercise drops, sometimes from Puma helicopters.
